intro: Consolida regalis var. divaricata, commonly known as the Divaricata Consolida, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its tall, branching stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly rough texture. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
